text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
IMMZD1ClientHistory 0..*BaseIMMZ.D1 Capture Client History for All Antigens
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference
patient 1..1Reference()Patient
type 1..*CodingType of dose
Binding: IMMZ.D1.DE103 ValueSet for Type of dose (required)
completedPrimarySeries 0..1booleanCompleted the primary vaccination series
booster 0..1booleanCompleted the booster series
dateSeriesCompleted 1..1dateDate when primary vaccination series was completed
hivStatus 0..1CodingHIV status
Binding: IMMZ.D1.DE10 ValueSet for HIV status (required)
pretermBirth 0..1booleanPreterm birth
immunocompromised 0..1booleanImmunocompromised
onART 0..1booleanCurrently on ART
vaccineHistory 0..*BackboneElementVaccine History
vaccineType 0..1CodingVaccine type
vaccineDate 0..1dateDate and time of vaccination

Documentation for this format

name: IMMZ_D1_Client_History
title: IMMZ.D1 Capture Client History for All Antigens
description: Data elements for the IMMZ.D1 Capture Client History Data Dictionary for the fields that apply to all antigens.

element.short: IMMZ.D1 Capture Client History for All Antigens
element.definition: Data elements for the IMMZ.D1 Capture Client History Data Dictionary for the fields that apply to all antigens.
The patient who is being checked for contraindications.
The type of dose in a series that the client received

Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen.
Indicates if the client has completed the booster series of a product/antigen

element.short: Date when primary vaccination series was completed
element.definition: The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)
The current human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) status of the client
The infant was preterm; the mother gave birth to the infant when gestational age was less than 37 weeks
The client is known to be immunocompromised. This means the client has a weakened immune system and having a reduced ability to fight infections and other diseases
The client is currently receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART)
History of previous vaccine doses.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: Vaccine type/category that was administered or was to be administered. Any vaccine code available in the IMMZ.Z Vaccine Library list of codes applies in this data element
Represents the visit/encounter date, which is the date and time when the vaccine was administered to the client

element.short: IMMZ.D1 Capture Client History for All Antigens
element.definition: Data elements for the IMMZ.D1 Capture Client History Data Dictionary for the fields that apply to all antigens.
The patient who is being checked for contraindications.
The type of dose in a series that the client received

Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen.
Indicates if the client has completed the booster series of a product/antigen

element.short: Date when primary vaccination series was completed
element.definition: The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)
The current human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) status of the client
The infant was preterm; the mother gave birth to the infant when gestational age was less than 37 weeks
The client is known to be immunocompromised. This means the client has a weakened immune system and having a reduced ability to fight infections and other diseases
The client is currently receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART)
History of previous vaccine doses.
Vaccine type/category that was administered or was to be administered. Any vaccine code available in the IMMZ.Z Vaccine Library list of codes applies in this data element
Represents the visit/encounter date, which is the date and time when the vaccine was administered to the client
